metaData.descriptionCS: The child answers questions that address a broad range of general knowledge topics.

answers.text: [Touches, points to, or otherwise indicates own or examiner’s foot]
Apple; Meat; Cereal; Fruits [Names anything typically eaten by humans]
[Verbally or physically indicates any number other than two]
[Verbally or physically indicates any other number]
Penny; Dime; Peso [Names one coin of legal tender, including foreign]*
Token [Names any coin of non-legal tender]
Gold; Silver; Silver and gold coins
Quarter and dime; Shilling and nickel; Penny and silver dollar
[Names any two different coins of legal tender, including foreign]
Turn it on; Put it in a pot
Heat it; Expose it to heat
Put it on the stove; Put it in the microwave
Make it hot; Put it in something hot
Turn the oven on; Put it in a hot pan
Cook it; Steam it; Warm it
[Verbally or physically indicates any other number]
Duck; Deer; Quail; Rabbit [Names hunting season(s)]
Snow; Rain; Sun [Names type(s) of weather]
[Verbally or physically indicates any other number]
It’s an organ; Part of your body*
Food goes there; For your food
It (growls, makes sounds, tells you) when you’re hungry
Digests food; Part of digestive system; Prepares food for digestion
Takes nutrients from food; Turns food into energy
Prehistoric; From the past; An old thing
Pictures on stones; Something carved into rocks
A water fountain; Water comes out of it*
Something organic that has (turned to stone, been preserved in rock)
Something that has turned into (rock, stone)
(Ancient, Prehistoric, Old) bone; A bone from a long time ago
Image of a (leaf, footprint, animal, dinosaur) left in a rock
An (imprint, impression) of something in stone
(Print, Imprint) left by something from a long time ago
Remains of something old; Remnant of something preserved by nature
Evidence of something alive in the past
A dinosaur bone; Footprint of a dinosaur
Traveler; A guy who traveled the world
Discovered (Asia, Boston); Founder of the United States; Sailed across America
Discoverer of (America, West Indies, the New World)
Sent by the Queen of Spain to establish a trade route
Sailed to prove the world was round
An explorer; Sailed across the ocean to discover land
Sailed with the (Niña, Pinta, Santa Maria)
An explorer who went to find a better route to India; A man who wanted to explore the Indies
Ancient (writing, letters, alphabet, symbols, words, language)
Picture writing; Writing systems that use pictures; Pictures used for communication
Sacred (characters, symbols); Characters that have a hidden meaning; Symbols that represent words
Writing used by (Egyptians, Chinese); Writing on pyramids
A layer; One of the layers on the earth; It’s around the (earth, planet)
Protects us from getting too hot
Has holes due to pollution; Thing that pollution destroys
Earth’s crust; In the earth; Part of the earth
Gases that keep the earth warm; Traps sunlight [Describes greenhouse effect]
Part of atmosphere that blocks (radiation, UV rays); Part of atmosphere that protects the earth
Protective layer on outside of earth
Layer that protects us from UV rays
Keeps sun’s rays out; Protects us from the sun; Protects the earth
Blanket of gases that cover the earth; A layer of gas
Three oxygen atoms; Layer of O₃
Stuff that absorbs light for photosynthesis
Measures something in the air; For measurement
Measures (weather, humidity, rainfall, temperature, wind speed)
A pressure gauge; Something that measures pressure
It predicts changes in weather; Tells if it’s going to rain
Developed theory of (evolution, survival of the fittest)
Wrote (Origin of the Species, Descent of Man, Natural Selection)
Studied animals in the Galapagos Islands
An ancient man; A man; Person
Chinese man who wrote (simple phrases, proverbs); Chinese writer
He developed a form of (philosophy, religion); Philosopher; Wise man
When the sun is closest to us
Day and night are the same length
Days get shorter; Longest day of the year
Sun behind the moon; Sun and moon lined up [Describes eclipse]
Day we set our clocks back
Shortest day of winter; Longest night of the year; Day with the least sun
When the earth is (tilted, angled) farthest away from sun
Sun lowest in the sky in northern hemisphere
Lava under pressure and cooling; Melted lava
Carbon; (Crystallized, Compressed) carbon; Carbon under pressure
(Transformed, Heated) coal; Coal under pressure; Compressed coal
A few hours by plane [Any number of hours]*
A long way; Really far; A lot of miles
It makes things radioactive; It’s (dangerous, bad, poisonous)
When two atoms fuse; Like in the sun [Describes fusion]
Atoms split apart and release energy
Sap of (fir, pine, conifer, evergreen, spruce) trees

consecutiveZerosDiscontinueRule.description: This subtest discontinues after 5 consecutive scores of 0 points.
